heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The nearest lightning strike was on 13 May 2025, at a distance of 4.97 miles.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 14 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (193°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1754 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the outside temperature (up 2.1°C) and feels like temperature (up 1.8°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.8 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (down 193 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 995 m), feels like temperature (up 4.4°C), outside temperature (up 2.8°C), and inside temperature (up 3.2°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 193.3m higher than yesterday, 420.9m lower than the past week, 995.1m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 557m and a high of 1248m, averaging 1139.0m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

summary.summary: Inside; relatively cool weather. Outside; pleasant, mild temperatures. Also, pleasant humidity levels and winds will be practically absent. Showers, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and the light is absent. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.
